net.ssehub.comani.data

Class CommitQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.ssehub.comani.data.CommitQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAnalysisQueue, IExtractionQueue

    public class CommitQueue
extends java.lang.Object
implements IExtractionQueue, IAnalysisQueue
    This class realizes a commit queue. A commit extractor supplies this queue with Commit objects, which a commit analyzer consumes.
    Author:
    Christian Kröher

      static class  CommitQueue.QueueState
      This enumeration defines the different states of the commit queue.

    • Method Detail

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Returns whether this queue is open (true) or not (false). This method should be used in combination with the IAnalysisQueue.getCommit() method in order to check whether obtaining commits from this queue is possible as only open queues will provide commits. Further, only checking for non-null returns from the IAnalysisQueue.getCommit() method is not enough as extraction of commits may take longer than analyzing them. Hence, a proposed combination of usage is: 
         
 while(queue.isOpen()) {
     Commit commit = queue.getCommit();
     if (commit != null) {
         // Do something with the commit
     }
 }
        Specified by:
        isOpen in interface IAnalysisQueue
        Returns:
        true if this queue is open and will provide commits; false otherwise

      • setState

        public void setState(CommitQueue.QueueState newState)
        Sets the state of this queue to the given new CommitQueue.QueueState.
        Parameters:
        newState - the new state for this queue

      • enableCommitCaching

        public void enableCommitCaching(java.io.File commitsCacheDirectory)
        Activates the optional saving of commits received via addCommit(Commit) for future analyses.
        Parameters:
        commitsCacheDirectory - an existing and empty directory to which the CommitSerializer shall save the commits provided to this queue; if null is given, which is the default value, saving will be disabled

      • getCommit

        public Commit getCommit()
        Returns the first Commit in the queue if its status is CommitQueue.QueueState.OPEN. If the queue has a different status or there are currently no commits available, this method will return null. However, returning null does not indicate that there are nor further commits extracted. See IAnalysisQueue.isOpen() for more information.
        Specified by:
        getCommit in interface IAnalysisQueue
        Returns:
        the first commit in this queue or null if the queue is not open or no commit is available

      • addCommit

        public boolean addCommit(Commit commit)
        Adds the given Commit to the end of this queue if its status is CommitQueue.QueueState.OPEN and the queue is not full.
        Specified by:
        addCommit in interface IExtractionQueue
        Parameters:
        commit - the new commit added to the end of this queue if the queue is open
        Returns:
        true if adding the commit to this queue was successful; false if the queue has not the status CommitQueue.QueueState.OPEN or there are currently too much commits in the queue
